Reviews.Title: “Nice stay to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: IlonaBar
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and comfortable with a nice surrounding area. You can go easily with bus 32 to town but, if you have time, the walk takes 30 minutes. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “dont be put off by reviews”
Reviews.Author: weeneill
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in march 2012 and was pleasantly surprised The rooms were clean and the breakfast good reception staff were pleasant Yes it is a fair distance from the city but a number 32 bus takes you to the vatican buy ya day ticket at the tobacci shop opposite hotel If you want a 5 star hotel then expect to pay the price overall this hotel was really good value for money and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by the "4 stars"!”
Reviews.Author: Sailaway1002
Reviews.Content: Quite frankly the only positive I can find for this hotel is that the rooms are relatively clean. Otherwise, would not recommend this property to anyone. Aside from the very strong smell of smoke throughout the hotel, the rooms are tiny (esp the bathroom, barely ANY room to move), the mattress was hard, pillows flat like pancakes, the walls paper thin. No water in the room (actually not even a glass). You are asked to pay €6 per day to use wi-fi but as this service is outsourced we were told that if it failed we would not get reimbursed. The most disturbing part of it all is that the hotel allows anyone onto the property. There were very suspicious people walking around the halls, and we were kept awake until 3am by a group of men yelling and banging on doors throughout the hallway. Not sure these were actually guests of the hotel. We were very close in calling the police. Amazing that reception did not hear anything! This hotel is at best an expensive and overrated 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “you wont sleep”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: well after every one being pickpocketed on the number 32 bus where the gypsys wait for you we landed at the hotel through the night some one kept banging on the door we thought it was some one locked out .the next night we were woken again by knocking went on till around one in the morning we met the refugees in the bar area they are arabic they said their was somthing not right about it as they push them selves on you trying to talk to you but the third night was frightning the banging started shouting running past the rooms screaming at people went on till two we rang reception to be told to stay in room police were comming after another half an hour or more nothing had happend we darnt move we could here ranting in arabic then rang reception again no one answerd we gave it a little while longer and we think they saw police at this point we had grabbed passports and bording cards and managed to grab the suit case opend the door and ran down the hall the police followed us down dont know why but no one was thrown out after police went all the (refuges) started to wonder around with mobiles and lap tops this is half three in the morning we thought we had been in a seige they say they are staying for four month good luck to you if you stay take a tazer gun you might get out of rome alive or at least your room when it all kickes off again

Reviews.Title: “Stop complaining and bus details!”
Reviews.Author: Allyb453
Reviews.Content: I suppose it all depends what you are used to. We needed a budget hotel which was clean and safe and that is what we got. Staff were fine and breakfast was good. Japanese students were a bit loud at night but hey, they are kids having fun........a quiet word and they were good as gold. Don't let the ramshackle market outside the front doors put you off. The hotel is in a perfectly decent residential area and the bus links excellent. Yes it would be more convenient if it was located closer to the sights. A bit more guidance for getting to the hotel the first time on public transport, especially if you are arriving in the dark like we were. So you catch the train from the airport which is faster than the bus, and then buy your week metro/ bus pass from a machine and take the metro line A, direction Battistini. Easy! But there are at least six exits from the Ottaviano metro stop and roads going in four directions. You need to take the exit labelled via Grand Cesare AND via Barletta. Then at street level the bus stop (Fermato) for the number 32 going in the direction you need is on a raised pavement sort of in the middle of the road (normally lots of other people with you). As you stand at the stop looking across the road you will see the Ciociaro Restaurant. Previous contributors have said count 16 stops which is not helpful if the bus misses stops! Better look out for a drive through Mc Donalds on your right a few hundred metres after which the bus turns right up a hill. Then the stop you need for the hotel, Flaminia Bevagna is approximately the second stop. There is a Barclays Bank on your right and a high school wall on your left. You can try asking the driver but they are protected with a screen which is a bit intimidating! If you get off too soon it is not so far to walk to the top of the hill. To get to the hotel turn down the side road adjacent to the Barclays Bank and walk say 500 metres until you get to a market square (empty at night). You will see the hotel across the square. It seemed a very safe area to us. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “poor location and service”
Reviews.Author: Linda716
Reviews.Content: We were not told by the travel company that this hotel is a 20 minute bus ride from the centre of Rome. This wasted valuable time since we were only there for a long weekend. The hotel itself was clean, quiet and fairly comfortable, but the service in the restaurant was very poor, as they were under staffed. The restaurant manager actually told another party that he wished someone would complain, as he was embarrassed.Food not brillant either.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out with nothing to do locally”
Reviews.Author: quakeasaurous
Reviews.Content: The hotel is half an hour by express train from the airport (15euro) than thirty minutes by taxi (18 euro) from Rome termini . There is nothing locally to do after dinner .The room was very good,clean,but the staff in the restaurant left a lot to be desired. The American bar was full of what looked like refugees on crutches, not a good atmosphere forma drink. The distance from Rome and what I mentioned left a lot to be desired. And we found the people rude

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: lemmingmo
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of less than complimentary reviews about this hotel we weren't sure quite sure what to expect. However, we found the room comfortable and clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the breakfasts more than adequate. Each morning there was a choice of cereal, yoghurt, rolls, bread, cheese, ham, salami, a variety of cakes e.g. croissants, pain chocolat, doughnuts, chocolate cake etc., tea and coffee - and as much of it as you could eat! There was a hairdrier in the bathroom, the shampoo and soap was replenished frequently and the balcony was big enough to sit out on - it even had a distant view of the mountains. Yes, it is quite far from the centre but this really isn't a problem as the 32 bus stop is very close (takes you to the Vatican) or if you walk down to the main road, you can catch the 81 which will drop you near the Colosseum. From the 32 bus stop (terminus) you can either walk past St Peter's, over the bridge to a number of nearby sights e,g.Pantheon, Piazza Navona (Restaurant Navona Notte just off the square is excellent and inexpensive), Piazza Campo dei Fiori, etc. or catch another bus or find your way to the metro. We bought a 4euro all day ticket but, in the end, we probably could have just spent 1euro for a 75 minute ticket (both tickets valid for buses and metro) as we found it preferable to walk. The hotel has a restaurant which provides an a la carte menu or menu of the day for 15 euros. We ate there on our first night and, for the 15 euros, we started with pasta, then had a pork fillet with chips and spinach and a choice of desserts. You can find more exciting food in the centre but it was OK for a 15 euro 3 course meal Altogether, we had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel and didn't pay a lot for it. We felt we had an extremely good deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Italian Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Rolling2B
Reviews.Content: Excessive noise every night....no internet...TV didn't work......lights kept tripping the micro switches so plunged into darkness.....breakfast .....like a cafeteria. Good points, clean bathroom, cheap. 15 Euros to centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good and very cheap”
Reviews.Author: Dmurphy1104
Reviews.Content: Was really apprehensive staying here as i read all the negative comments on here. The only bad thing about the hotel is its location. It is a little bit out of Rome but if you dont mind travelling 15-20 mins to the vatican and then another 10-15 mins into the centre all for only 2 euro, then its fine. |The room basic but was clean and tidy which is all you should expect from a hotel that costs so little. The breakfast was good too. Bread, ham, cheese, coffee, juice, yoghurt and a selection of sweet things. I really dont know what everyone who complains on here are expecting for the price you paid. I didnt have much dealings with the staff but found them to be the same as most Italians. Italians seem rude/standoffish by nature, thats the way they are...hotel staff or not, thats just Italians. One other thing regrding Rome which has nothing to do with the hotel...BEWARE TO BE RIPPED OFF EVERYWHERE YOU GO. As a foreigner, locals will try to increase all prices...in shops, stands, restaurants, cafes, even pharmacies so be on guard

Reviews.Title: “not near enough to rome”
Reviews.Author: fiona h
Reviews.Content: Due to weather nothing was running and possibly got the last cab for 60euros to hotel.The only place to eat was the restaurant who had a queue waiting and very little staff.The food was very poor,veg cold from fridge and staff complaicent to your questioning.BIG suggestion do not to eat here.Breakfast ok.Room clean tidy and all domestic staff friendly and accomadating.Restaurant,bar and reception staff should swap jobs with the domestic staff,but i feel they would not do a good job.Taxi rank was right outside and even with windows closed could contstanly hear phone going.Get more central if sight seeing.Hotel has no general info leaflets.

Reviews.Title: “DODGY!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMountain
Reviews.Content: Exactly! Stay away! I would spend a few more Euro's and stay somewhere nice. The hotel itself is fine. it is just about these "guys" around the reception and in the lobby. They are there at all times wandering around with computers. They follow you to the floor and stand real close next to you. I have the feeling that they are "copying" or "scanning" credit card details and use that on their computers to buy things. THe girl who works the bar send signals to these guys to tell them who has credit cards. Also the guy "working" in the souvenir shop doesn't go unnoticed. The staff is rude and not interest in you. They laugh everthing away. I forgot to mention that there was one guy having a broken leg one night and the next day his arm was broken. Weird. Another point that interest me is that the manager of the hotel never reacts on any bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “On outskirts of Rome use public transport or it will cost a fortune.”
Reviews.Author: England1975
Reviews.Content: Starting with check in. There were 3 people on reception when we checked in however none of them seemed to want to serve us. When they did I found them rude and unhelpful. We asked how to get into Rome from the hotel and we were told there was a map on the wall. I'm sorry but this is totally unacceptable. This hotel does not even appear on the tourist map. If you want to get to Rome without costing a fortune you need to go out of hotel and walk forwards until you reach a road. Turn right at top and walk to end of road. Across the road on left is a bus stop. Get bus 32 to Ottovario Metro link. (It is near to the Vatican) from here you can access the metro for €1 a trip or €4 a day or €11 for 3 day tourist ticket this price includes buses as well. We had to get this information from other guests as like I said hotel staff were unhelpful. Next Bedroom- More to a UK 2 star standard. Old needs updated and small. We also had twin beds which as a couple we found frustrating. The rooms were clean and tidy and the cleaning staff were very polite. Food- Breakfast was very basic with croissants, ham, cheese and bread, cereal, yoghurt and various cakes. Could do with some fruit. Dinner- We ate in the hotel on one occassion and the food was over priced and to a poor standard. The service was also poor and I had to ask 3 times for some water! Would recommend to go out of the hotel and use T Bone station at end of road where the service and food were great. Check out- We paid the €3 a night city tax which was fine and expected. We were not even thanked for our custom which is very unusual. We put our cases into storage and had to wait 10 mins and ask twice for someone to get them. The reason this is so annoying is the keys were behind reception all along and the cupboard was joined to reception. Would not recommend this hotel if you were planning a city break in Rome as you will waste at least an hour in transport time on bus or 17 mins and and a varying price in a taxi to city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Toni05400
Reviews.Content: The place is not bad at all! Obviously in Rome 4 Stars are not as 4 Stars in Germany (where I live), but the price was just awsome!! 100 euros (excl. toursit fees) for three days for double room! We didnt experience much of the staff, as we had no problems at all! The breakfast was really big (the hotel has a lot of rooms), but most of it was sweet (I guess thats an Italian thing, as it was the same in Lignano). The quality of the food was average, but for 100 euros, what can you expect.. The location is not too bad, it is on the Metro station of Vatican, but with a bus which travels 20 minutes to the hotel ... You always have to ask for the bus stop, as the bus drivers dont announce the bus stops, and skips some of them...

Reviews.Title: “Too far out and zero customer service”
Reviews.Author: MinkyMooBoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a package with Thomas Cook, when we arrived at the airport Rome admittedly had been caught out with the worst snow storms in 30 years, so the first thing to go wrong was our transfer didn't show. On calling they just said they couln't make it. After an hour or so on a bus getting into Rome then spending E45 on getting a taxi to the Grand Fleming Hotel we were then told that the restaurant was fully booked and the bar wasn't open (it was 9pm) so we would have to go out for anything to drink eat, which after a day's travelling to get there we weren't too keen on but trudged down the road as we'd have otherwise starved. The following three days got worse with snow and the service went down hill from there! The staff aren't interested in the guests at all. The rooms are basic and clean but no hot drink making facilities and the "mini bar" consists of 2 cans of coke, 2 beers and 2 bottles of water Breakfast is a very basic continental, dried bread, croissants, cheap ham and cheese and yoghurt The hotel is a long way from the centre, when the road were cleared and we could actually get a taxi it cost E10 each way, the buses weren't running when we stayed. The hotel is little more than a large B&B with staff with no interest

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - poor service poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2207gsm
Reviews.Content: This is all about expectations. As a 4* Hotel we expected a reasonable degree of service and quality but got none. It was a difficult time as Rome was hit by the snowstorms but staff were unwilling to help. Restaurant was closed unless you had paid for half board and the staff at reception were more interested in their own conversation than trying to help.. Rooms were clean but very basic. Breakfast was also basic with an additional charge if you dared to want fruit.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain via Expedia, suburb !”
Reviews.Author: CasaVolpe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Fleming for the last 3 nights. Loads of hot water, crisp cotton sheets, superb towels changed every day. Breakfast was included in the cost. It's continental, with plenty of cereals, coffee, ham, cheese, orange juice. The hotel has its own restaurant which is good value for money. There is a 15 Euro menu in the evening. The hotel is in a quiet square. You can catch a bus No 32 which takes you to the Vatican for 1Euro. Would not hesitate to return to this Hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't looking forward to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tylertomo
Reviews.Content: After lots of negative reviews about this hotel I wasn't looking forward to this break, however,our experience was not as bad as others I have read on here, everyone's expectations are different, as long as I have a clean bed and half decent bathroom I can put up with the rest. This was our first visit to Rome and we only paid £334 for three nights including flights for two people, so hey what do you expect? I would not rate the hotel as a 4star,no way!!Bedrooms are old and quite small but we were hardly in it so it wasn't a problem for us. Yes, the hotel is a bit out of the way,as before take the no 32 bus from ottavia bus stop. .The transport system is brilliant.We prebooked the terravision bus from Ciampino airport for 8euros each return to the termini, where we caught the metro A line to Ottavia. It took us a few minutes after coming up to the street to find where no 32 bus stop was as there are several exits on a crossroads-but its not too difficult.It is approx 16 stops (25 mins) to the hotel in the flaminia district (a word of warning- there are 6 stops within this district-get off at the 2nd, we made a mistake & got off at the 1st and got a bit lost)At the termini you can get a 1euro ticket which is valid for 75mins (it doesn't matter how many times you use it within that 75 minutes-metro or bus)or you can buy a 1 day ticket for 4euros, which we did on our 2nd day and travelled all over Rome by bus and metro.Brilliant! A must do is the vatican museum tour and also a tour of the colosseum and ancient rome.All in all after my initial worries we had a really good stay. If you want a budget hotel-no frills and not 4star, and don't mind the location-go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Irenejanine
Reviews.Content: After reading some very negative reviews, I was pleased to find that our experience was very different. The hotel was clean, beds & bathroom were fine , nice balcony. The staff were friendly- say hello to Viviana - the bartender - she is a great girl! The continental breakfast isn't to everyone's taste but there is plenty of it. We stuck to the ham, cheese, bread and yoghurt,& nice fruit juice finding the cakes a bit too sweet for the morning, cappuccino was great and they have English tea too. Did not need to eat again til evening. Yes, it is a bit outside the city, and we got lost trying to find it, but once you know it is not difficult - take the Metro to the Vatican and then a 32 bus to the hotel. As you need to travel quite a bit would recommend the Roma Pass covers all the transport for 3 days and 2 entrance fees. - just our luck the metro went on strike on our second day so did not use to full advantage and watch for pickpockets on the metro - didn't feel a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, gloomy, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: Mintaa
Reviews.Content: A very disappointing hotel, the 4 star rating is a joke, 2 star would be generous ,

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous deal”
Reviews.Author: maletero
Reviews.Content: This hotel may seem unattractive because it is not centrally located, but its great features and incredible prices make up for the location, which is not that poor, really. Th ehotel is connected to Rome's underground by a bus (# 32), which is quite frequent, so it's not that bad. It is also quite close to the Vatican, which can be attractive for tourists and pilgrims. We booked through Venere.com, and got a great deal, partly because of the low-season period: we paid 60 euros for the double room, with breakfast included! The hotel is a huge operation for Rome standards, with many rooms and services. The rooms were ok, with a TV and minibar, and also a small balcony (which must be pleasant in less rainy periods). The bathroom had no window, nor apparently a fan, but it wasn't too bad. The pipes were noisy when you opened the sink faucet fully. The shower was great, with very strong pressure. Staff was helpful and spoke decent English, and the restaurant in the hotel seemed ok, but we never tried it (when we tried, it was full and they sent us away). The breakfast buffet was quite good, with pastries, cereal, ham and cheese and juices. Alas, in a country that is famous in the world for its coffee, the coffee was really disappointing, as it came out of a machine - they could improve on that. As we did not have our laptop, we used the Internet point in the hotel: 6 euros for an hour, but if you log out properly you can save the remaining time for a next session and use it later. All in all, we had a very good time there. Definitely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor security, old, dingy”
Reviews.Author: dextervhc
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and cramped. The shower curtain was filthy. Decor very old and worn. The floor was linoleum which I hate in a hotel room. Rather noisy. Bed wasn't very comfortable. No iron available. A fellow traveller's handbag was stolen from her in the lobby when she put it down right next to her feet for about 10 seconds. The bathroom had an emergency pull cord hanging in the bath, but if you fell over and couldn't get up there is no way you would be able to reach it. Breakfast was quite reasonable, hot chocolate for us non-coffee/tea drinkers, plus delicious yoghurt and the usual continental stuff. When I asked to use the internet in the evening, I was told the computers were 'not working' - in other words, they were switched off for the night. They were on in the morning but I didn't have time then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about rome”
Reviews.Author: christine279
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice with helpful staff and adequate rooms. the cafe across the street to the left is very good. the bus is 1 euro into rome but don't forget to stamp your ticket in the machine on the buses the police will fine you and not give a receipt. Rome is a nightmare to navigate and unless you have won the lottery do not take a taxi. Down the street from the hotel on the way to the bus stop oppisite the supermarket is a smashing cafe/restraunt, very friendly people and oppisite therse is a great takeaway pizza place which is very good value and very tasty pizza with friendly staff. Personally I wouldn't go back as I thought it was dirty, overrated and the people -other than the working class people are arrogant, igorant and down right rude.

Reviews.Title: “First 2 nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kgoldgirlnj
Reviews.Content: Was very apprehensive about this hotel after reading so many negative reviews. We were pleasantly surprised. Rooms was adequate and clean. Had a wonderful dinner in the dining room the first night. I had lamb chops that were fork tender. Really spoiled me for some of the other dinners on the tour. The manager went out of his way to be sure we were pleased. Breakfast was great-lots to choose from. We had lunch the first day across the street at a busy pizzeria which was very good and reasonable. There were also vendors in the little square in front of the hotel. I believe that Americans need to adjust their expectations when traveling in Europe. Rooms and bathrooms are smaller. In some of the older hotels the bathrooms are rediculously so, but you are in them such a short time why complain? I believe that Cosmos made a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “It’s not a Grand Hotel: embarrassing rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: albyIMF
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Grand Hotel Fleming in the first week of October 2011 for work. The hotel is located near the “Foro Italico” so it’s very far from the downtown (about 25-30 minutes by taxi) and the only way to come to downtown it’s to take a taxi because there is a near underground stop!! Be aware that the Grand Hotel Fleming is the typical hotel where organized tour with big Pullman come with a lot of people … so if you make the check in when arrive the organized tour will be wait a lot of time!! The room was very bad with old and low quality furniture and there is also a bad smell. The bathroom was so little that when you open the door you must watch out because the bidet is just behind the door!! The air conditioning is very noisy and if you can sleep you must switch off!! The room is embarrassing for a 4 stars hotel!! The breakfast was terrifying … there were so poor food and with low quality!! The hotel is not recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a long distance from any of the tourist sites in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michele S
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, spacious and unremarkable and the staff wasn't particularly interested in being helpful, although they did speak English. The hotel was packed with tour buses full of guests. The bed wasn't comfortable but the shower was hot. The included breakfast was pretty good. Our biggest complaint is the location--an overcrowded 30 minute bus ride from everything else in Rome. Considering how expensive Roman hotels are, this isn't the worst, but it's far from the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T Sleep tight and the bed bugs WILL bite.”
Reviews.Author: zekiep
Reviews.Content: Awful, awful, awful. We were transferred to this hotel when the hotel we'd booked into favoured the football team over us and gave way our room. Do not be fooled by the 4* guidance. It's a 2* at best and truly one of the worst hotels I've had the misfortune to stay in. Aside from the staff being rude and unfriendly (perhaps that's a requirement when working for the "LO.AN" hotel chain) the hotel itself was a dump. The rooms were obnoxiously small, with cheap laminate flooring and paper thin walls. We were kept awake all night by our upstairs neighbours dragging a chair across the floor every 5 minutes (to give them their due, there was so little space between the bed and the wall that the chair was against, that the only way to get past it was to move it! The bathroom was dirty as was the rest of the room, mould patches and cobwebs in various places. I was bitten several times during the night, from something either in the bed or on the blanket needed, as there appeared to be no heat available! The one redeeming feature was a fabulous restaurant 5 minutes away that we wouldn't have found if we hadn't stayed there. "La Locanda" - Fabulous!!!! Grand Hotel Fleming - Not so fabulous!!!! Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, no sleep, tiny room, cobwebs, mildew, noise - TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Edward P
Reviews.Content: Mr Magoo is the only person I think who could give this hotel 4 stars. The rooms are tiny. The floors are laminate so the chairs upstairs scoot and you can hear them all night. The neighbours escapades were easily heard with earplugs in. There were cobwebs in the door frame, mildew in the shower. My wife was bitten by bugs several times. This room was a disgusting 2 star hotel at best. Rude staff - I have stayed in better hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Big pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Autobotn
Reviews.Content: This is a big city hotel, which is located in a quiet place. The hotel is not new, but everything is in good condition. The room was enough large (for Italian hotels) and clean. Bathroom equipment is new (includes bath, shower, WC, bidet). Every day we had our towels changed. The service is good. We had BB, breakfasts were good but standard. The disadvantage is location. This hotel is situated far from the historical center of Rome (it is necessary to take a taxi or to go by bus), far from the subway (metro) station, and far from the bus stop (7-8 minutes walking distance to the stop).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tom317b
Reviews.Content: Being worried by some negative reviews we (2 Singaporeans, 1 European) staid at the hotel nonetheless and were positively surprised. Location: yes, it's not next to Colosseum, but a cab from the Spanish Steps back to hotel took less than 10 minutes and cost 12 Euros. That is a fair price, although my companions were subject to a cab scam in downtown Rome (driver not switching on the meter on short distance), unrelated to the hotel. The neighbourhood is nice though, residential area with a small market and shops right on doorsteps of the hotel. Rooms: ours were not only not small but in view of the rate (around 70 Euros per room) a good buy indeed. Bathrooms had obviously received a touchup (new bathtub, sink, toilet and bidet), and the bedroom was absolutely OK. The bedroom in decent shape, although the safe in my room didn't work (batteries gone). There might be other rooms where maintenance might be worse, but on our floor (4th) it was absolutely OK. Only two English language channels on TV though (BBC, CNN, the latter always flimmering). Reception: upon arrival around 8 pm there was only one receptionist on duty (other one obviously out for dinner). He had some problems in answering the hotel's main phone line (the phone never stopped ringing), checking in people, handing out whatever guests of a 300-bedroom hotel were asking for. However, we got our keys after about 5 minutes. Restaurant: overpriced, didn't use, went across the road the first evening (not recommendable, avoid the Grappa, tastes like jet fuel), the second day about five minutes downhill a nice place on Via Flaminia Vecchia with a roof terrace, good food and very pleasant service. Breakfast at hotel? Yes, messy when the tour groups charge the buffet, but you get what you need. Conclusion: I booked the hotel because it's used by tour groups like Cosmos and they normally don't put their groups where management and staff are unreliable. The name is misleading (it's not "Grand" anymore) but I don't think you'll get a better deal in Rome for the kind of money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “very clean but room small”
Reviews.Author: john_dr7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The room was clean, but small. The location is ok. the front desk clerk is courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected but several minor issues”
Reviews.Author: stollj3r
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed four nights at the Grand Fleming Hotel in Rome. I only paid €30/night as I booked my room via hotels.com and used a voucher which got me another 10% off the bargain price. For the amount I paid the room was quite good. The hotel is currently under refurbishment which means that some areas (e.g. breakfast room/restaurant) look very fresh and modern whereas areas are a bit more dated. My room looked like its last refurbishment took place at some point in the early noughties. Nevertheless, everything was clean and the members of the room service did their job very well. As other tripadvisor members pointed out, there are some negative points which need to be mentioned here. The walls really are paper thin. Without earplugs falling asleep is hardly possible. There are tour groups from Spain arrving every night at around midnight by coach. People from Mediterranean countries appear not to pay too much attention to people wishing to sleep in the middle of the night. Another issue is that the hotel does not provide proper blankets in white linen. The only thing to be found when arriving is a seperate bedlinen to cover your body with. As a person not coming from Southern Europe I need a blanket to snuggle up in no matter how warm it is. The hotel staff literally tries to convice you that this is very strange. We had a conversation that took ten minutes before the issue was finally solved which I don't consider to be too nice. I then got something which looked more than a rug for the dog than a proper hotel blanket in linen. Yummy!!! Public transport to Central Rome is good via local buses/underground. The 32 service takes to you the Vatican area in about 15-25 minutes with buses arriving every 5-10 minutes. It's a 2 minute walk to the next bus stop. There are good supermarkets around (i.e. BILLA) as well as a pizza store and a McDonalds for those tourists not fancying Italian food. The general area looks safe.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Bette P
Reviews.Content: The hotel as a whole is fine. The check in was pleasant and the room was clean. The only real problem is the location. It is nowhere near public transportation which means either a long walk or an expensive cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: DrBob317
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a Cosmos tour. The hotel has a nice ambience to it. Our room was spacious and we were fortunate to have a balcony which meant that doors could be opened for a breeze during the day. The room also had air conditioning which was appreciated. The bathroom was adequate. Despite being some distance from the city centre the hotel had a number of cafes and restaurants around it. Staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. We had to pay for internet access but that was to be expected. The breakfast (continental) was adequate. Hotels in Europe don't seem to do good orange juice, though.

Reviews.Title: “Can’t understand the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: jamesjhhill
Reviews.Content: I really can’t understand all of the negative posts. Me and my partner travelled to Rome in April 2010 and stayed at the Grand Hotel Fleming and I would have to say that for the money we paid, I was quite impressed. The hotel is around a 15-20 bus journey from the centre of Rome and the bus stop is literally round the corner from the Hotel. We got confused with the buses a little bit but generally finding your way around is pretty straight forward! We spent 3 days in Rome (2 nights at the hotel) and I have got to question why, when you’re in such an amazing city, would you want to spend any time at all in the hotel. We were looking for a clean hotel where we could have a nice shower and some breakfast - we got exactly that. My partner and I drove all through Italy and there is parking available behind the hotel which costs about 10 Euros a day (which I thought was cheap considering options available elsewhere). I have to say that there is a restaurant right opposite the hotel which provided one of my favourite meals of our trip. It’s quite a quirky little place (I’m sure I remember wallpaper on the ceiling and carpet on the walls!) but the food and atmosphere is great! If you are standing at the entrance to the hotel facing the road, it’s at about 3 o’clock (to the right of the square) – you can’t miss it! P.S. Some of the photos on here are quite funny! Chipped paintwork . . . oh no!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Chaos”
Reviews.Author: liverpooleric
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Cosmos Tour. The hotel is OK, not 4 star but reasonable 3 star. The room we stayed in was clean and well equiped nice bathroom with good shower, however other guest had older rooms which were not so good. A major problem was breakfast we waited 20 minutes in aqueue just to get in, the dining room is just not big enough to cope with the hundreds of people looking for a table and nothing like enough staff clearing tables. Not that the food is worth waiting for, just bread rolls and jam mostly

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, not up to par”
Reviews.Author: beanieonthego
Reviews.Content: Stayed at "Grand" Hotel Fleming 2 nights on a COSMOS tour. Upon entering the guest room, first thing I noticed was mold on the walls, which was very disconcerting. Air-conditioning was very iffy, which made for an uncomfortable night in the hot summer weather. My brother-in-law says the dinner he had there was the worst he has ever had in any hotel anywhere, and he is a world-traveller. The pictures on the internet are very misleading, and must have been taken in the hotel's heyday, probably 20 years ago. This hotel claims to have a 4-star rating, but believe me, it would not even be considered 2-star in the USA. Nothing about this hotel is in any way "Grand." Would definitely not recommend, and certainly won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hope for the best expect the worst”
Reviews.Author: podium_boy
Reviews.Content: `Hope for the best expect the worst`. At times a cliche phrase in life although acknowledge that it is not entirely pertinent to this experience, it was however not far from the truth. Pre - conceived expectations are not good practise however I dare say that I had low expectations in view of already established poor reviews of this hotel as indicated in our booking website. Immediately this was realised as we had waited up to 4 hours to check in although acknowledge that initially we were two hours early. We had booked for three persons and finally when we were advised that our room was ready only a double bed was made available. We were provided an extra roll out portable bed until we had discovered that there were rooms in the hotel which catered specifically for our request. We were then transferred to a more suitable room however by then our patience had been challenged. To the contrary I was apologetic as I wanted to sustain some level of rapport throughout our stay; - poor customer service at concierge particularly with certain staff - housekeeping did not change linen / clean room adequately after each night Although I acknowledge that the staffing level in regards to professionalism only affects a minority, the vast majority are in the best interest of the customer. The location is effectively convenient easily accessible by bus to the Vatican. The hotel facility generally consistent with a four star. However although inconsistent, it is difficult to rate this hotel higher than average in view of our experience at check - in.

Reviews.Title: “very bed hotel.Never go there.”
Reviews.Author: miaomeng
Reviews.Content: This is unbeliveable hotel. Please not book the hotel and never go there. they will take you money from you bank account before you go there And you can not get you money back., If you cancell the hotel you still can not get the money back. The receptionists are absurd staffs They get more than 20 emails but nobody reply your email. This is not a real four star hotel! Please get my money back!!!!!!!! I have no patient!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: sgyuris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. At our arrival we were pleased by the courtesy of the front desk clerk (Alessandro). He was knowledgable, courteous and friendly. At the lobby we were approached by the bartender who brought us a nice cup of capuccino and bread. The room was clean, but small. They offer complimentary breakfast which was pretty good. Coffe, OJ, a wide variety of pastries, cereal and tea. The only inconvenience was that this hotel is not tourist friendly located. We had to walk two blocks from the hotel to take bus 32 (this is the bus that takes you out of that area). It is probably a 20-30 minute ride from the hotel to the Vatican. The city is so beautiful and reach in culture and art that the ride in the bus was rather entertaining. At night time the bar offers a nice variety of complimentary d' oeuvres, which we accompanied with a glass of wine. They have a TV which is set on the latest soccer game or the latest news or local variety show. Nice environment. We felt safe in that neighborhood. Be aware that every store is closed by 8:00 p.m. So if you need a last minute snack or a pharmacy item, make sure that you get it earlier than 8:00. Right diagonal from the hotel there is a little snack place.. mini restaurant where they have nice meals, pastries and nice coffee. As I said, we were pleased with the service and cleanliness of this place.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: kiddy68
Reviews.Content: I wonder on which basis stars are given to Italian hotels. the staff at reception are nice and helpful but... We were surrounded by teenagers on school trip banging on doors and shouting until 1 am, the room doors let in all sounds, we slept poorly-reception adivesed to call them in case of too much noise so they then call the police should the students not coply by the 2nd warning...; you hear loud voices from above/below rooms and can follow phone conversations taking place in the next room; breakfast is in a huge room with no appeal at all, quality of food on offer cheap. on the good side; towels and bedsheets changed every day.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, overpriced, walls like tissue paper”
Reviews.Author: sandrainbarca
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as i had to travell the next day and it CLEARLY stated it provided a shuttle bus or airport transfer on request, After eventually finding the hotel (one metro and three busses from the center of rome) i was tired and eager to get my head down. firstly they told me there was no shuttle bus and were quiet aggressive about it and told me i could get a taxi for 60 euro. then as i went to my room the key would not work in the door as to whick the recption staff turned their eyes toward the sky when i mentioned this. eventually when i got to go to sleep i could not do so as the walls were paper thin and could hear every one from agoining rooms go to the toilet and "other" such things. Would not recoment this hotel and will be writting a complaint to the manager him/herself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a bit far from everything.”
Reviews.Author: J-L-1977
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a nice area, with shops and cafes, but is a looong way to Rome's main attractions, you can not walk, a mean of transport is required. There is a bus stop nearby and a Taxis stop right in front of the hotel... if you don't mind taking 1 hour ride to the Vatican, then is a good value for the money. Staff is friendly and the small rooms are clean... The breakfast is an european standar buffet, cheese, ham, milk, not great but sufficient. Next time in Rome I am staying in a better located Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Labtech666
Reviews.Content: First off, the location is not great. It's quite a long bus ride into the centre of Rome, but the bus stop is just round the corner from the hotel and tickets only cost 1 euro from the shop over the road. Once you stamp the ticket on board it's valid for the next 75 minutes which is plenty of time. The rooms were small, but sufficient (After all, we were only using them to sleep in!) and the bathrooms weren't a bad size. Really powerful shower, and fresh soap, towels etc every day. I would have preferred a duvet, but there were plenty of blankets and a couple of spare pillows. The mattress was really comfy too - not too soft or too hard. I was a bit concerned about noise when we first checked in as the surrounding area has a number of shops/cafes etc, but it had quietened down by the time we went to bed so didn't disturb us at all. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Choice of cereal, croissants, pastries, rolls, cheese, ham. Eat enough and you'll be fine until dinner time! The staff on reception were surly and not especially organised, but ultimately they were fairly helpful. The rooms were cleaned well and the communal areas of the hotel were clean and tidy. For the money, I thought this hotel was well worth it although I'm baffled as to why this is a 4 star hotel. I've stayed in much nicer 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for shoulder season”
Reviews.Author: bluelavaart
Reviews.Content: We had a great deal from the internet on this hotel. 45 Euro a night plus 3 euro a night city tax per person which had to be paid during check out in cash. The hotel was large and in a nice piazza with a local market. There was a supermarket down the street too. It is a 25 minute bus ride (#32) from the nearest Metro stop (Ottaviano). The rooms were just fine for the great deal we had. We stayed there for 2 nights. The room was a bit stuffy and we couldn't open the window but overall it was comfortable. The staff was amiable. The breakfast was standard buffet fare, nothing special. We did see the staff collect uneaten brioche from tables and replated them on the buffet....that was a huge turn off. We didn't try the restaurants or bar within the hotel. The walls are VERY thin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcmonogram
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a tour group. The location is good. Walking distance to many cafes and shops. The buses are nearby. However, the rooms are very small. The walls are VERY thin. You can hear everything that someone says or does nearbye. Could not figure out how to drain the bathtub. When I called they sent someone immediately. I payed to use the internet here. When I could not figure out how to use the @ sign they were helpful. The four star rating seems deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “**** Star Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: mhy70
Reviews.Content: Minus: 1. Small rooms 2. Very loud people working&staying there ... 3. Not clean - we found hair on the blanket, misery in the bathroom 4. Not easy to find ... Positive: 1. very nice neighborhood 2. Low price compared to the city center

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Rome! Stay Away from it.”
Reviews.Author: fabrizioMal73
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of having spent a night in this hotel and I would advice everybody not to make the same mistake. The hotel and its staff don't deserve 4 stars. Even 1 would be too much. Rooms are small and uncomfortable, the restaurant it's a joke (unless you have to eat there, in which case it's a tragedy) and personnel is unfirendly. I paid 90 euro for 1 night (When I booked, I found it quite cheap). This rate would be unfair for 1 star category.

Reviews.Title: “My mom died in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: carpedeum
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy for a week. We had a great time until our last night we stayed at this hotel because we were flying out of Rome the next morning. There was no air conditioning and we begged the manager to turn it on, at least in my mom's room. It was VERY hot in the hotel. He never did and she died at 4:30 a.m. on 10/4/10 in her sleep. She died of a heart attack brought on by excessive breathing difficulty due to lack of air conditioning. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kroshini
Reviews.Content: This hotel - although adequate is about half an hour away from rome city centre by bus. Rooms are of a decent size, small bathrooms, jus the bare essentials BUT definitely NOT sound proof and I don't know if there is a problem with the ventillation but intermittently the room would smell of smoke. Breakfast is cheap, generic continental. Staff are not overly welcoming. Shuttle to the airport is also incredibly overpriced at 60 Euros! I think you can find a better hotel for a similar price if not marginally more in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars for the Worst Customer Service Ever - a must read”
Reviews.Author: Y-T41003
Reviews.Content: On a recent European adventure, 2 memorable days were spent in the Eternal City. With its much vaunted history, Rome is a must see on anyone’s European itinerary. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said of the four star hotel that was supposed to be one of the good ones in town. Grand Hotel Fleming advertises itself as a four star hotel located in one of Rome’s exclusive quiet residential areas, Collina Fleming. Arriving at the Hotel at midnight, after a tiring 6 hours drive from Venice, I noticed the first signs of trouble when I couldn’t find even a temporary parking spot to unload our luggage. Opting to unload at the front entrance where it’s obvious temporarily offloading is allowed seemed to get the night manager very upset. Assuming neither I nor my wife spoke any Italian, the manager went off on his reception desk attendant berating him for letting us park there. The attendant tried to explain that that he would check us into our room and then instruct us to move the car but the Manager was having none of it, evidence by his arrogant stare and sinister comments about ‘Damn Americans’ while we are standing right in front of him. Little did he know we are not even Americans but an Ethiopian couple who spoke Italian. After such a horrifying welcome, we were taken to our room that turned out to be completely different from what’s portrayed on the Hotel’s website. It was one cramped room, even in European standards, on very tight quarters. There was a dresser at the foot of the bed whose accompanying chair needed to be moved every time we wanted to pass by to the bathroom, which was also very small, but at least, it was clean. The lack of ample sound proofing is another identifying feature of this so-called ‘four star’ hotel as noises could be heard from adjoining rooms. The continental breakfast served in the morning partially made up for the horrible experience the night before. Although it didn’t offer anything special or a good variety to choose from, the breakfast contained some good croissants, cookies, coffee, tea, and some juices. However, the lack of customer service was also very apparent as the Hotel staff made it clear that any guest was a nuisance to them. Realizing that our chances of finding parking are nonexistent, we decided to leave the car where it was parked, on the street, even though I had called the hotel prior to my arrival and was assured a parking spot for my midnight arrival. While hanging around the lobby the next morning, we observed the reception desk staff that replaced the ones who greeted us earlier, similarly mistreating their customers and even making fun of a customer’s Russian heritage in Italian while the customer was standing in front of them. Right after that arrived a young woman who had just checked in earlier to find out her room’s door doesn’t lock. The woman tried to make the point that she is alone and cannot be expected to sleep in a room with unlocked doors. Both the attendant and day manager’s response was to either take it or leave it. Aghast at the continuously disgusting behavior of the Hotel staff, I walked over to the Manager and told him everything I had observed since my arrival in Italian. To my surprise, his reply was an arroagant ‘what do you want me to do?’. It was at that point that I went back to my room to pack up our luggage and leave this horrible hotel with my wife. We cancelled our second and third night reservations and left immediately without any reimbursement, vowing to never even consider Rome again, let alone such a hotel. The level of customer service provided by the Hotel staff is beyond arrogant, snotty, and downright rude. It is such a ripoff!

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away from this Hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlexP40
Reviews.Content: I am speechless at the level of customer service we got from the front desk staff, they were arrogant, snotty and down right rude!!! I will rather sleep under a bridge next time in Rome!!!!! Please people....rather pay a bit more but stay away from this so called 4 star hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel-please pay extra and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Lotus1984scot
Reviews.Content: We are recently back from a stay in this hotel and I could not say strongly enough to please book elsewhere. The man on reception who dealt with us initially was pleasant enough but his two collegues sat talking to each other whilst a queue of waiting guests was beginning to form behind us. The room was clean but absolutely tiny. There was a dresser at the foot of the bed that you had to move the chair from if you wanted to walk past. The balcony was more of a window box with a horrible industrial view. The bathroom was also very small and the sink leaked. Another point of contention for me was the complete lack of sound proofing. Our room must have been beneath a store room as every night and morning, noise similar to chairs scraping across the floor was heard. Also, one night we recieved a call from reception saying someone had complained about the noise coming from our room. This was perhaps 11pm and we were merely talking and having a laugh. No parties in sight! We told this to reception but half an hour later a hotel worker pounded on our door saying we must stop the noise. Also, the maids came round to clean the room between 8 and 8.45am.. I dont claim to be lazy but I dont feel I should have to be up and out every day at that time when on holiday. However, I do feel I should point out that I experienced no problems that other travellers here seemed to in regard to buses etc. We bought week passes when we arrived at the airport which we invaluable. The number 32 bus is a two minute walk from the hotel and this takes you to the Vatican city. However, we jumped out a few stops before this and took the metro from there. Very easy to get to all tourist places from here. In general, this hotel is barely worthy of two stars and the staff make it very clear that you are a nuisance to them. I would recommend spending a bit more for a good three star hotel and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff; won't reimburse money”
Reviews.Author: mpcollins
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible - stay away! Not only is it far away from everything in Rome, but the staff is unpleasant and unaccommodating. We ended up cancelling our reservations for a second night within the desired time frame, which was weeks ago - and I have still NOT been reimbursed from the hotel, with no explanation of why.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: K0rrupt
Reviews.Content: My family back in the USAI had ordered a walking tour of Rome - they had already payed in advance for the tour and for the taxi from/to the hotel for us... when the taxi driver came to the hotel to pick us up, he went to the front desk and asked the person behind the front desk to ring our room so we'd come down. The person behind the desk was too lazy to do this, and instead told the taxi driver that we were not checked into the hotel. The taxi driver then left, and we did not get to go on our prepaid tour. As soon as I found out what happened, I went down to the front desk to discuss the issue with them. They refused to accept responsibility, and told me that 'the taxi driver had told them that we'd been checked into the hotel for three days, and that's why the hotel worker didn't call up to our room'. When one of our family members called the hotel, the front desk couldn't even be bothered to pick up the phone. When I tried calling down to the front desk from our room, they also did not bother to answer the phone. It makes no difference how long we were checked into the hotel, the fact is that we WERE checked in to the hotel!! Also, the room was stifiling hot and the A/C did not work - when we went to the front desk, the guy behind the desk told us that 'the A/C only works between 5:00pm and 9:30pm'. When we went out and came back at 5:30pm, the A/C was still not working. When we said something to the front desk once again, he then told us that 'the A/C is central with only one control, so that if it's not working in our room, it's not working anywhere in the hotel'. Yet again, too lazy to follow through with ANYTHING!! We asked if they have Internet computers and they pointed us down the hall - when they of course didn't work for us and we went back to the front desk to say something about them and ask them how they work, they told us 'they currently are not working'. Yet again, too lazy to follow through with ANYTHING!! The people working in this hotel are ignorant, lazy, and useless. We'd rather sleep in the street than ever go near this place again. it is by far the WORST hotel we've ever had the misfortune of staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel - especially if you are with a group”
Reviews.Author: NKLamb
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Fleming during our October 2010 Cosmos 6400 tour. The hotel was perfectly fine for our purposes. You can ride Bus 32 (available a few blocks away) to the Vatican and on to other sites in Rome. Not convenient, but not impossible, and some of the people in my group took the bus to the Vatican the day we arrived without any trouble. You can buy bus tickets further down the street at the newspaper stand. There is a small market right across the street from the hotel where we bought fruit to supplement the continental breakfast, and other small food stores nearby although none of them are open on Sundays. We walked to a nearly Billa grocery store to buy cheese, fruit, wine, and bread for a picnic lunch. An ATM is available across the street, as well. The room was fine, although it was a little bit tight walking between the foot of the beds and the dresser. Bathroom was a good size, with a tub, plenty of hot water, and big towels. I use earplugs when I sleep, especially when I travel, so noise wasn't a problem for me, although others did comment about it.

Reviews.Title: “You can get better for the same price”
Reviews.Author: LizandBrett
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Would not recommend to anyone. When we arrived the lobby was packed with a coach load of tourists and the staff were in an aweful mood. Even when the lobby was not packed, getting helpful assistance from the front desk was difficult. (Although cleaning staff were friendly, as was the girl at the bar - but this by no means made up for the feeling that you were an inconvenience at the front desk) The televison in our room was small and looked like one from the mid-eighties. Neither the internet or wireless was complementary. The walls were paper-thin, and, with the number of coaches using the hotel, the noise from people up and down the hall went well into the evening. While the breakfast buffet had quantity, the quality was not very good and the coffee was almost unpaletable. It is not near any attractions, and the bus stops don't have buses direct to the Termini so you have to make at least one change on the Metro or buses to get there. Bus 32 does however go to the Vatican for sightseeing, but don't expect to be able to get a ticket on the bus - ensure you have purchased one from the Tabacconists near the hotel even if the staff tell you otherwise! How this hotel a four star is beyond me. There are much better places to stay in Rome (check out the Ars Hotel, unfortunate name, but better service and amenties for less Euro and only a short walk to a direct bus line to the Termini).

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen039
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal if you are traveling on a budget. The hotel needs to be updated. The pictures on the website makes it look more modern. Staff was friendly except for on rude man at the front desk. The breakfast was not enjoyable. The vendors across the street offered great prices on beer and wine. A short work to the 32 bus will take you to the Vatican or metro. This hotel is about a $50 dollar cab ride from the airport. The walls in the rooms are very thin

Reviews.Title: “Really not thàt bad”
Reviews.Author: livius
Reviews.Content: I hardly write a review, but in this case i will, because all the negative reviews lately I found unjust. I ve been twice this year in Fleming hotel -november 2009 and july 2010- and i think this: - price quality is very good. For say 60 euros you can't expect Hilton, but it' s still way ahead of much of the ugly accommodations near Termini Railway Station - bath rooms are small indeed, but consist of all necessary ammenities - not all rooms are the same. In july we had a renovated room which I actually liked much: strong air conditioned, good matrass - forget the breakfast - 4 stars is indeed too much. So are many 3 stars hotels in rome overrated et cetera. - good, gratis and reasonable secure parking place - location: not in front of the Pantheon, that's clear. Some busses in nice area (Romans consider Fleming a good residential zone) go in the direction of the center (i don't posses Fleming stocks!) -

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! Terrible location and service”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTravelbuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with Cosmos tours. The hotel is not central to Rome at all. The service was terrible. We asked how to het into the city. They told us to take the bus and pay the bus driver for a ticket because there were no shops open to buy a ticket. We tried to pay bus driver but he didn't take it and closed the door. After a couple of stops ticket inspectors got on and tried to fine us 50 euro each. We had to get off the bus and wait over 1 hour in 36 degree heat for the police to come. The inspector would not listen to us and I called the hotel to get them to confirm that they had instructed us to do that. After some negotiation we paid 50 euro between 5 of us. We were not happy that the hotel gave us false information! Breakfast was like a production line. Nothing special and no personal service. I would definitely not recommend this hotel at all. We transferred to a B&B called Gli Scipioni near the Vatican city. Awesome location, clean new rooms, ironing board, tea and coffee and snacks all day. Fantastic owner who is English and was so helpful. Definitely stay here!!! Only complaint would be a noisy air con... But that's it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: colatusso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far far away from a real 4 stars hotel... the receptionists are rude! the wifi didnt worked for me and I had no support from them... instead I got people who didn't know what is education... and thats sad. The breakfast is average... and the dinner isn't very nice if you're traveling with a large group like me... anyway if you really want to stay there, take the bus 32 to get to the Vatican, it's cheap (1 euro) and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Not in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pike21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from the center and difficult to get there by bus or metro, it was easier to get a taxi. The walls wer so thin that you could hear all what was happening in next door. Breakfast was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “This is a BAD hotel!”
Reviews.Author: newsf
Reviews.Content: That place is terrible, not even close to a 3 stars hotel. VERY noisy, horrible tiny dirty bathroom. I asked a room with a balcony. There was a room, a balcony, but NO door to go out. Figure that out! The balcony was dirty with pigeon s... anyway! Far from the centre, the buses are always packed. I had to wait for 3-4 buses before getting on one. A normal 20 min ride at night takes 1 hour during the day because of the traffic jam, standing up! DO NOT GO THERE

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Eve018
Reviews.Content: This ain't no four star. I don't know what Expedia was thinking. The size and look of the rooms was exactly like the two-stars near the train station. Plus they had dark, dingy bedspreads and saggy, tiny beds. But worst of all, the hotel was out in Timbuktu. It wasn't even on my map, which shows every street in Rome. It is out in the suburbs and takes a half-hour tram ride to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Not to complain”
Reviews.Author: Aletheia7
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for 2 nights and chose this hotel because the price for the double room was very good, with breakfast included. The rooms were ok, not large, but not too small either. The bathroom was small, but you wouldn't need more than it had. Overall, the room was very decent, clean, with large bed and balcony. When you go in Rome to visit the city, you don't need anything more than this hotel offers you. Cleanliness and a good breakfast, with a very good cappuccino from the express machine. The main disadvantage is the distance from the city, but you can take bus 32, it gets you to the Vatican and it links to the metro. You get to the city centre in about 45 minutes. The staff seemed very nice, one of the receptionists was very amiable and humorous. Enjoyed talking to him.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, for the length of time your in your room.”
Reviews.Author: nickeymontoya
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful days in Rome,(not with a tour group) before moving on to Florence, and our room was very clean, with a great big window. We could hear street traffic when we had the window open, However we only used the room to sleep. "Who can stay in the room when all of ROME is waiting to be explored. The Grand Fleming is outside of Rome proper, but a 15min. bus ride and a brisk 3 block walk will get you there with out too much trouble. I would & have recomended the Grand Fleming to others that I hear are planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place! dont stay here”
Reviews.Content: This hotel was listed as a 'top secret hotel' and also under its own name! We would have NEVER picked it under its own name and feel we were tricked! it should not be listed as top secret if it's already on the list. Our room smelled of stale cigarette smoke. The bathroom was no bigger than a cupboard with a crap shower. The staff that we had talked to when checking in were not one bit friendly! It is a trek into the city, reading the review it said that there is easy access by public transport, this is nothing more than a lie, we rang to ask which bus to get and they told us that we would have to get a metro then change over to a bus and told us it was easier to get a taxi!! The television was a small bit bigger than an ipod screen and the atmosphere couldnt have been worse. The breakfast was included in the price but we didnt even chance trying it. We would have much prefared to spend more and stay central. There is no way it is only 5 kilometres from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickknock1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. Its a nice neighborhood, just bit out from the center. The rooms were average size, but the bathrooms rooms are on the smaller size. This is a fine two star hotel. The fact that they have four stars is just open fraud. There is no way by any measure this could be a four star hotel. If they improved the rooms, and service, they would be a three star at best. The breakfast was average hotel fare. One major issue is they cut off the air condtioning at night to save energy. It was so hot we had to open the windows for air. My family was then attacked by misquitoes. So pay no more then you would for any other two star hotel, or you will be ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: jml-derby
Reviews.Content: The hotel is too far out of the city centre and not at all 4 star standard. The bus service was ok, but taxi's are untrustworthy and expensive. The hotel is very basic and the room was quite small. The bathroom was very cramped. Only Eurosport and News channels available in English. The staff were truly awful and extremely unhelpful which made our holiday more difficult and not as stress-free as we'd have liked. The breakfast was adequate but nothing special and the waiters were loud and miserable. Only stay here if you are desperate to go to Rome and have no other place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “far from the center but very nice”
Reviews.Author: BazdnikinaA
Reviews.Content: it is true that the hotel is far from the center. it is about 15 mins by bus and then by metro. but the rest was fine, nice room, excellent service and people at the reception that spoke really good English. in other Italian hotels we stayed at during excurcson tour around Italy there were problems with English speaking staff. good dinners. nearby there is a cheap supermarket. i stayed at the hotel three nights and it was not noisy. i was suprised to read so much about noise in the reviews. good 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel to stay at Rome”
Reviews.Author: terrario
Reviews.Content: If you are a big guy, probably you have to demolish the bath room to get in. The rooms are smaller than a cruise stateroom. The hotel is located so far of Rome center. You have two choices to get the center, first pay a taxi $25 or walk half a mile to the nearest bus station, have a trip of about 30 min or more and then walk another half mile to take the metro to get colisseum or Piazza de Spagna. (1hour more or less) The hotel is not quiet as they said. You can hear at 1am the garbage truck collecting the garbage container located in front of the hotel. And the best is that you don't need the TV (all italian channel) because you can hear the couples making love in the contiguous room. The A/C is not working because the outside temp is below 70, but you can open the window or the balcony door....

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lilybella09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our recent Cosmos tour. The staff was friendly and helpful. Always happy to answer questions, call a taxi, whatever. Beautiful spotless room with a balcony. Absolutely no complaints. Some of the reviews I've read showed people were not happy with the location. But part of our enjoyment was walking around the area and discovering local color and quiet little shops! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Fauziah
Reviews.Content: Booked an extra night at the hotel while waiting to join the Cosmo tour a day later. I would not have minded a small hotel room if it is centrally located but Fleming was out of the way and there was no Metro nearby. Once you put luggages for 2 people, there was hardly any room to move. Overlooks a street that is noisy at night. Breakfast offered reminded me of boarding school food. Lifts are tiny but after 2 weeks on the tour, realised that small old lifts seem to feature a lot in most hotels in Italy. We had a few days at the end of the tour before our flight and we treated ourselves by checking in a real 4 star hotel with modern rooms, amenities and good supply of toiletries. Family of A. Khan Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Comos Tour STop Splendors of Italy-Clean but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Italy_Feedback
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the start of the Cosmos Splendors of Italy Tour. Having read prevoius reviews, the hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. My main issue was the noise. These rooms have floors and the walls are paper thin. It is out of the way, but can be reached by taking bus 32 to metro station or a 10 min cab. On the advice of another reviewer, to the left of the hotel, walk down one block and there is a small grocery store where you can stock up on water, fruit etc.... There is a small cafe out front, but in general the hotel is in a residential area. As a woman, I felt safe in the hotel and area . Breakfast offerings were limited. Italians just do not seem to eat alot at breakfast. Get used to ham, buns, cereral, cheese. Overall the hotel would not be my first choice, but it is not the worst either.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Decent Hotel - Archers/Cosmos tour”
Reviews.Author: DrKB
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights whilst on the Treasures of Italy Archers tour, and this was by far the best hotel we stayed at. The reception staff were extremely helpful in advising us on how to get public transport into town (which is quite a long journey - 10 minutes on the bus, then 10 minutes on the tube), so we managed to buy tickets and make the connection very easily. There is a nice little bar by the lobby, and the breakfast was good (cold meat, cheese, bread, the usual). There is a full mini bar frige in the rooms. Dont be put off attempting the trip into Rome alone, it cost one euro for a bus ticket (one way) and a euro for the train (one way). Buy your tickets before you travel, rememebr bust tickets are valid only for about 70 minutes after you buy them (and must be inserted intot he machine inside the bus to validate them) but you can keep your train ticket on you all day to use for the return journy - one ticket per journey. You can buy bus tickets from the tobacco shop just by the bus stop round the corner from Hotel Fleming, take the bus all the way to the Vatican where it terminates, follow the signs to the metro ('Ottaviano' station) on foot, buy your ticket from the machine inside the station (all in english and very easy), and hop on the train to 'Spagna', and you'll come out right at the spanish steps, easy and all done in 30-40 minutes. The trains run really late into the evening and are easy to use, so long as you dont dawdle getting on and off as the doors shut really quickly. So if you are on this archers/cosmos tour, how about not paying (quite a lot of money) for the optional evening excursions and doing it yourself for just a few euros, instead sit by the Trevi fountain or have a coffee at the Cafe Greco, or stroll about and people watch by the spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Clena hotel, Poor location & tips for Cosmos tourists”
Reviews.Author: ArmchairGypsy
Reviews.Content: We were here in May on the Splendors of Italy tour by Cosmos. Was terrified having read awful reviews of Cosmos hotels and this was the first hotel on our trip. We were pleasantly surprised. While this may not be our first choice of hotel by far(we stayed at the Delle Muse before we joined the tour and loved it - pls see our review of that hotel on this site), it wasn't too bad. Yes, the location leaves much to be desired but we did manage to find 2 things that are really useful for Cosmos tour groups like ours. 1. The tiny grocery store that is in the same square as the hotel(walk out and go straight. it is the last store in the square, next to a meat shop) is a great way to save money. We picked up a huge six pack of 1.5 -2 litre bottles of still mineral water(aqua minerale naturale) and some juices and iced tea for 8 euro! When you see tiny 500ml water bottles being peddled for 1 euro at the sights through the rest of your trip to your fellow travellers you will see your savings adding up! We packed the unopened bottles into our half empty suitcases and removed one to drink each day of our trip and filled its space with shopping! 2. A great little bakery/takeaway on a street parallel to the hotel.Exit hotel walk to the left top corner of the square to get to the main road(2 mins walk), turn left and almost immediately you will see another quiet road leading off this main road, parallel to the one leading to the square you came from. Walk 500 m down this road(if you need to walk more than 2-4 mins you are on the wrong road) and to your left you will see a red illuminated sign advertising coffee, pizza etc.(caffe/pizzeria/pastaceria) They make great lasagna, grilled vegetables, pizza, heavier meat/chicken based meals all for takeaway. They pack in cutlery too which is great. We picked up lasagna, pizza and dessert for 6 euro and took it back to the hotel to have with our juices and tea from the grocery store. The hotel menu offers pizza and a drink for 15 euro per person and is not too great so this was well worth it at 1/3 the price for two people. Taxis into town cost 12-15 Euro. Room air conditioning was not on in May and it was starting to get warm outside. So we slept with the door to the balcony open...if the air con isn't on in June it might be quite uncomfortbale, but in May at night it was pleasant. There are better options for independent travellers but for Cosmos group travellers, it is not as bad as people would have you think! Room was clean, and neat, tv had English channels, lifts were normal sized and worked fine, breakfast was basic(ham and cheese with breads and coffee), room size was average (not tiny but not as big as one is used to either). Room was quiet and we got a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for what it is”
Reviews.Author: srysemus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Cosmos Splenders of Italy Tour. Had read all the reviews and was a bit concerned. The only problem with this hotel is that it is on a noisey street and not too many restaurants that are open on the first night we arrived (Sunday). In fact within 2 -3 blocks only 1 small cafe was open on Sunday night. Our room was very nice and clean, in fact we were lucky and got a room that even had a small sitting room with 2 love seats - hardwood floors all around which was something I have never seen in the states, but loved about the hotel. It was cool in the evenings so we left our windows open and we were fine except for the street noise but again not a big deal as I was very tired both nights. Breakfast was no surpise as I knew what to expect from the Tour, if you do not like cold cuts and dinner rolls for breakfast then do not do a cosmos tour. That was breakfast everyday in each hotel. Our 2nd night we also had no problem as we went to dinner on the optional excursion. As we arrived late the first day I really do not know how hard it is to get into central rome from this hotel but I still had no problems with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way....”
Reviews.Author: TIffany946
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the Cosmos Splendors of Italy Tour. I had read some reviews, but I always keep an open mind while traveling, and I suggest you do the same! Hotel Fleming was clean, and the room was very SMALL. They also do not turn on the air conditioning in Italy until very late in the season, June or July. So, the room was very hot and we slept with the window opened, which allowed many outside noises in, including the grocery store deliverers across the street. Traditional European hotel bathrooms are also very small, including the shower. The showers are SO small that I couldn't even bend to shave my legs! This hotel is also a little out of the way, but taking a taxi was very inexpensive and easy to get. I felt safe in the hotel, and they also provided a safe, which I suggest you use if you stay at any hotel. Also we had two twin beds here at Hotel Fleming, this is very traditional in Europe, and we found it really funny!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: GailMeo
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from Rome and the last two days at the Grand Fleming. DO NOT ruin your Rome stay by booking a room in this dump. The neighborhood is sketchy, it is a 20 Euro ride to St. Peter's Square. There didn't appear to be anywhere to go at night locally. The room was tiny - appeared to be clean but old and smelled musty. The bathroom was a joke - shower so small you would have to step out to retrieve the dropped soap. Not for the claustrophobic. The food was terrible, especially breakfast. We were herded downstairs like cattle to an unpleasant breakfast. Even the orange juice stunk as it was watered down. The coffee was worse than dishwater! People at the front desk were rude - Like I said - stay away. I felt lucky I didn't find a rodent in the room. Spend a few more dollars and go someplace decent.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad! Not Bad At All!”
Reviews.Author: cospringstraveler
