Reviews.Content: We were a part of a partially guided tour with Cosmos in October and this was the hotel that they use for this particular tour. I, like others, had read many negative comments but I found that this hotel was just fine and that, although it was about a half hour bus ride to the city center, the #32 bus stop that takes you there was just a short walk from the hotel (bus tickets are sold at a tobacco shop just to the right of the hotel, across the street). Also, the residential/retail center around the hotel had it's own character and even a small market that opened on Monday morning right across the street. All you have to do to find restaurants, a gelateria or two, and a good pastry shop is walk around a little and that is not unreasonable. If you had a view of the main street outside the front side of the hotel, you can get a pretty hilarious view of the parking situation---amazing how many Smart Cars can fit into a particularly small space and how "creative" Italians are with parking! I saw no reason to complain of this hotel but then again, when I travel, I don't complain much anyway. In my opinion, If one has little flexibility when traveling, then one should stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a budget tour”
Reviews.Author: HowieQ
Reviews.Content: September 2007 After reading previous previews, we were very skeptical on this hotel, but upon arrival, our view had changed. The room, bath room were up to standard, we had hot water , breakfast was very good and plenty. The location even though is not right in the center but when you walked out the hotel, there were taxi cabs waiting, a trip from the hotel to the center (ie. Fontana Trevi) is around 9 Euro , from there, you can walk to Pantheon, Spanish steps, or even Villa Borghese. It's a very short walking distance, you just stroll and follow the sign... We also would like to state that we took Cosmos budget tour, and we are very happy as everything was well organized, from the arrival at the airport, to the departure from Hotel on our last day. Our tour director Ciro and our driver Alberto was exceptionally friendly, and helpful. It was worth the money we have spent, and if you buy the ticket, book the hotel plus transport from one city to another, you can not beat Cosmos prices.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, convenient hotel near Rome”
Reviews.Author: mira118
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the City center. The bedroom is decent size. The bathroom is nice with a bathtub included. Breakfast was good. The elevators were small and slow to move through the floors. I would recommend staying at this hotel if you want to be close to the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: The Fat Punter
Reviews.Content: I was very worried after reading some previous reviews as we stayed here as part of a Cosmos/Archers tour, however it was not that bad, although not perfect. The room was small but clean, the bathroom was tiny, but clean. The bathroom walls were very thin. You can literally have a conversation with your neighbour when in the bathroom, however the actual bedroom walls were not too bad. The air conditioning was a strange carry-on mind you. It is located BEHIND the curtains so that at full blast your room will still be hot but the windows will be freezing, this can be remedied by doing a little tinkering and using the ashtray as a kind of weight to hold the curtains down and then dangle them arould the edges of the a/c unit. Also, the a/c seemed to be automatically timed to go off somewhere between 1 and 5 in the morning. You are a good way from Rome itself and there is only one small bar in the area. We found the breakfast to be very good although as a tour you are confined to the basement and as there seemed to be a lot of tours staying there (the hotel is massive) it was very busy. For the price that was paid the hotel was not bad. Let's face it, you would not spend your whole summer vacation here but for a day or three as part of a tour it was good. The staff we came across were not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town”
Reviews.Author: planeteer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the suburbs of Rome. There are public transport links, luckily, as it is too far to walk to the sights. Apart from a small bar across the road from the hotel, there is very little else nearby as this is a very residential area. In fact it seemed bizarre to find a hotel in this area. The room was okay, but nothing special and, as we were part of a tour group, we were restricted to having breakfast with hundreds of others in the basement. The food was very basic with a restricted continental menu. We would not stay here again if travelling independently as the negatives far outweighed the positives.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I've Stayed In, By Far”
Reviews.Author: xLoquitax
Reviews.Content: The second stop on the Archers Direct tour; we were here for three nights, and are completely regretting it. Hated this hotel! We were lucky to have a room with a balcony, but it was in an industrial area that was noisy and smelly. The restaurant was terrible and overpriced, and nothing was edible in the breakfast buffet except for the orange juice, which was the same everywhere. Staff at front desk were rude and uninformative. Drinks were overpriced, and the bar was never open. We waited an hour to get drinks, and the barman brought the wrong thing. Oh, and be warned that the air conditioning is turned off twice a day at irregular hours. Do not be surprised if you return to a sweltering room!

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Safety Box is not safe”
Reviews.Author: mataAlberta
Reviews.Content: We were with the Cosmos Tour group when we stayed in this hotel for two nights. I would like to warn future travelers who are tempted to use the safety box provided to them in their rooms NOT to. I used their safety box by putting some of my cash and I thought it should be safe because it is a safety box. Then we went out for the night with the group. But before leaving the hotel that afternoon around five, someone was knocking at our door. We did not answer. We heard that someone is still trying to open the door. So my husband opened the door. It was one of the front desk staff and when confronted all he said was sorry and no other explanation why he was opening our door. Also, he uses the phone to check if you are still in your hotel room. We did not think of anything about this incidents until the following day of our departure when i took my cash out of the safety box, some were missing. He did it discreetly so you do not make a big fuss. So please let this be a lesson to all travelers - avoid this hotel your money is not safe in their safey box!

Reviews.Title: “Awful attitutes of the staff”
Reviews.Author: nerdlywehunt
Reviews.Content: What arrogance from the staff. No dedication to customer service and if they had to smile it would crack their face. If staff can not be patient, friendly and courteous to their guest then they need to get another job in another industry. The front desk guy with the mustache IGNORED me for several minutes. No one was in line and then when decieded to help me he acted like an arrogant fool. Rooms were mostly clean and several in our group of 28 had airconditioning problems, problems wiht the room safes. Go somewhere else if you are American. We stayed in 12 other hotels and this was the only one that I definitely would NOT go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room”
Reviews.Author: WI Boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a Cosmos tour group. The room was the smallest we had in Italy, but was clean and comfortable. We had a balcony that overlooked a green neighborhood of apartment buildings. The bath was small, but atractive. The staff were not too friendly. Breakfast a standard continental buffett. It's about a 30 minute bus ride to the Vatican area. The food in the hotel is average, but the service was terrible. We couldn't get into the 1-2-3 restaurant. We found a "cafeteria" nearby where you pick what you want and pay by weight. We had pizza, pasta, veggies, bread and sodas for 15 E total. They had tables outside. Go out the front door, across the piazza and down a small walking lane and it's right there on your left.

Reviews.Title: “hated location”
Reviews.Author: mel777dublin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i had booked into the grand hotel Fleming's sister hotel Villa Glori on arrival we were told that the toilet was broken and that we were being moved to hotel Fleming and that it was a four star. We were bitterly disappointed the room was awful it was covered in damp and smelled of stale smoke! The decor was from the 1970's. Also we were freezing the amusing thing was that the heating kicked in at about 4.30 am and was so noisy it was ridiculous and ticked continously! We thought we would never leave also the location is so far out only 1 bus which justs leaves you at the Vatican! Thankfully after a few phone calls we were moved back to Villa Glori which was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Good”
Reviews.Author: MZ-TarvelGuy
Reviews.Content: Well, I stayed there as part of a Cosmos tour, like most of the other reviews here. It was pretty far from Rome but maybe a Euro 15 taxi ride, I had hot water but others didnt (the trick is to shower 15 mins before everyone else!), room was clean, ameneties were poor, reception greeting was good, nothing aorund it, NO AIR CON as many of these cheapo hotels control it centrally - thank god I wasnt there in the summer when it's hot !!! Breakfast was included but was TERRIBLE - bad bread, some cheap cold cuts and cheese and cereal. No fruit etc. If you are looking for a cheap hotel (this is maybe 2 stars) then its ok as a tourist for short stays. If you are part of a Cosmos tour, you will stay here the first 2 nights. It will be the worst of the cheapo hotels Cosmos puts you in but marginally tolerable. The week before I stayed in the Caveleiri Hilton - 5 stars but Euro 400 per night off season. Fleming is maybe 80-100 Euro. You get what you pay for !

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Girlguides
Reviews.Content: Italy, Hotel Flemming, Rome. Date 13. 09. 06 Reviwer - Girlguides The hotel was magnifient, the staff were very friendly and all spoke English. The guides were over the moon with the food and the price for our evening meal was not expensive, but was very busy. We stayed for 6 nights and we wished it could have been longer. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious, we had 3 sharing a room. The only downfall was it was not in the city centre, but was a 15 minute bus drive away. Buses ran every 10 minutes and ended at the Vatican and cost only 1 euro. My guides and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fleming was Not that Bad!”
Reviews.Author: WonderBeagle
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from the Cosmos "Essential Italy" tour and was expecting a horrible stay at the Hotel Fleming after reading mostly negative comments. I agree the hotel was far from the center of Rome but Bus #32 was within a two block walking area and it was very easy to get around on the bus. Overall the hotel was NOT that bad. Our room was on the first floor so we did hear some street noise. The room was very clean and so was the bathroom. The hotel reception staff were friendly and helpful. They served an European breakfast which was different than our American one but it was okay. And we found a McDonald's within a ten minute walk of the hotel! Exit to the right from hotel, walk two blocks as if you were going to catch Bus #32. Go left and at traffic light, make another left and walk down about a 1/2 block.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: USAMay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first stop with our tour group. Seems to cater to tour groups. Rooms were clean, though only basic. Most of staff spoke English. Dinner in the hotel dining room was not good. Perhaps because it was included as part of the tour package. There is a very good restaurant on the square just out of front door of the hotel - Hostaria Del 'un 2 Tre. Quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you know how to use the buses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of tour. Clean and decent rooms but location is far from sights. Convenient to use Bus 32 (buy tickets at Tobacco shop to the right of the hotel entrance) to Vatican. Nice local shops. You can change for Bus 40 (free transfer) which takes you close to Plaza Navona/Campo Fiori to dine. Hotel dinner was bad. Breakfast traditional meat/cheese and breads. Better to pay a bit more and stay in town.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: CHAMUCO1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in Feb. 2006. This hotel is where tour operaters bring their groups so there is always a lot of movement in the public areas. The front desk people are helpful enough and the rooms are clean but small. The bathrooms are also small and the tub in my room tended to leak from the bottom creating a very large puddle which I reported immediately and was assured it would be fixed but it wasn't. I corrected this problem by turning off the water while shampooing and bathing and turned it on to rinse. I really have no complaints about the hotel in any regard except that is is VERY VERY far from anything a tourist would want to see in Rome. I did learn to use the buses to get everywhere which was a good experience, but I would rather be in the middle of things even if the hotel is of a lesser quality, so I would not consider every staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Tourist Hotel for Winter in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Electricdance
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome started in January at the Hotel Flemming. We had read the reviews and were plesently surprised with the Hotel Flemming. Bathrooms were too small for socializing,but large enough for other purposes. Room with balcony was warm and clean (A/C problem that a few people seemed to have, not an issue in January (A perfect month for Italy, unless you love crowds, line ups and sweat) I'm sure that when the hotel is packed in summer you may not get the same personal attention, but the staff spoke English (Why do we never question why we don't speak a little Italian)and we're always helpful. ATM on the other side of the street. Bus stop a short walk, 1 Euro to the Vatican (I think that many people don't pay at all, just get on and get off)Paid 80 Euro a night. If your new in town don't buy from the guy who sets up in front of the hotel doors, or divide the prices by 3 before thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Grand Hotel Fleming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we expected, but believe they have recently renovated. Hotel and rooms are very clean, staff is friendly and helpful, and are able to speak English perfectly. Rooms are a little on small side, but is what we expected in this hotel. It was Christmas time and there was a decorated tree in lobby. We had a balcony off our room so we could look out over the neighbourhood. Market across street where we could purchase fruit and souvenir items. We took one bus from near hotel to Vatican City for $1 Euro each way. It was a very nice hotel for the price we paid and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not completely bad but avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: derob
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights on a business trip. I disagree with reviews rating it terrible. It is not, and incase you didn't pay more than 90 Euro for the night you can't really complain. There were loads of tourists being of loaded in the hotel from bus trips, so this might be the most likely way in which you will get here. The hotel seems to be hard to reach by public transport, and there is no parking available (incase you dare to drive in Rome). Also it is far outside the city center. I would try to aviod other hotels of the same chain (LE.AN), as they might use this hotel for overflow in busy periods. The rooms are small and tired indeed, and my toilet smelled of stale urine (for the rest it was pretty spotless). Also the doors where like paper so everything which went on outside the room was loud. In this case the other guests near me understood this, and were quiet, but otherwise the stay could have turned into a bad experience. Positive point are the quality of the bed, and perhaps the restaurant (for fast, easy cheap dinner in the neighborhood, I've seen quality of food and better breakfasts). Also the bar was fine, and the staff not unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!! Don't Stay in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travelpinay
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days in this hotel. We joined Cosmos tours. The hotel was a market place. The hotel was packed by tour groups – tons and tons of them. Breakfast was a nightmare. There was no place to sit down. There were times when they ran out of food, plates, cups and utensils. The room we stayed at smelled like stale cigarettes. The hotel staff was rude. Plus the hotel is located too far from the Vatican. Please stay away from this hotel....it is definitely a nightmare!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heart Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please don't stay in this hotel. There is no heat at night, washroom is extremely tiny. The toilet is 2 feet away from the sink or less. When you get out of the bath tub, you can easily fall down, cause there is hardly any room to move. The staff at the front desk are very rude. I don't think they understand English or they just don't care. The first night when our tour group arrived. We were served dinner by very bad mannered waiters. They dumped the pasta on your plate as if you were in a soup kitchen. When I asked for a little more mushroom on my pasta, the waiter yelled something in Italian & of course I got no mushroom. The following morning, during the breakfast time in the hotel, one of the girls in our group got her purse stolen right at the breakfast table. Poor lady ended up spending that day in the police station filing for her lost of her money & plane ticket that were in the purse. This hotel should be renamed as 'Hotel of horror'.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nasty. Cosmo tour. 1st problem is that it has roaches. Second is no showers, only a bath. The rooms are very small. You can hear your neighbor ---- next door. Staff is rude, better bring a iron cause they dont have one. a good $15 euro to any attraction

Reviews.Title: “No A/C”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many problems. It is a distance from town but there is a shuttle service that is cheap, bus that is near by and taxi cab is not too expensive. The biggest problem with this hotel (aside from the rude staff) is their lack of air conditioning. Apparently they do not believe in cooling off their guests at night. The A/C shuts off in the middle of the night for all the hotel rooms and comes back on mid afternoon. We were there with a tour group and stayed for 2 nights. The first night we woke up at 3am burning up in September and thought the air was broken in our room. We had to sleep with the door open to get a breeze in our room. The next morning we learned everyone on our tour had the same problem and that is when the front desk advised they turn off the A/C at night. What a joke- they waste so much water each time you flush the toilet yet they are too cheap to cool down their guests while they sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a fan...”
Reviews.Author: Tagger87
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers mention, this hotel has an issue with air conditioning. They don't seem to think we need it! We stayed there for two nights and then returned for a third night as part of a tour. Our first room sweltered. The air conditioner was on full blast and could barely be felt three feet away. Then they cut off all a/c units at 2 am, leaving the room even more unbearable. Our second room was a little better, you could feel the a/c up to about 5 feet away. The staff is very aloof and somewhat rude. You can stand at the desk and they will totally ignore you. You evidently are interupting their busy day. I also worry about security. They only provide one key per room and we were advised by our tour guide to leave the key at the desk whenever we left the hotel, as there would be a large fee if we lost the key. When returning to the hotel, all you had to do was give a room number and the key would be handed over. No ID required, no questions asked. You could ask for any room key and they would have just given it to you. Scary...

Reviews.Title: “Ok but too far away”
Reviews.Author: KeepingRoadsWarm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fleming for 3 nights while in Rome. The information provided in other reviews about the air conditioning were correctly stated, so for those of us who are used to a/c all the time, this was a problem, I woke up several times all sweaty, with no real way to cool off except by splashing off with cool water. I'm sure this would be even worse in mid summer. The walls of this hotel were extremely thin, we could hear every move made in the adjoining rooms, from sliding out of chairs, television, wake up calls, conversation, coughing, and even flushing of toilets. And my hearing is not great! And we had quiet, elderly couples on both sides, instead of young, party people. I'm sure it would be unbearable if that had been the case. Even though the location was far out of town, the bus was accessible (unlike the other hotel I stayed in which was UNREACHABLE by public transportation) The taxi ride for me and two others to this hotel was 67 Euros from the airport. I liked the neighborhood, and had gelato at the corner restaurant for a reasonable price about the same as home. We bought bottled water at the corner store for a reasonable price as well. Overall, the staff was ok, not friendly by US standards, but not rude, just still seemed to be surprised by our expectaions of cool air at any hour of the day. I won't stay here when I return to Rome because of the time and expense wasted getting back and forth to the hotel, and because of the noise levels from other rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel Fleming
HotelInfo.Address: Pza Monteleone Di Spoleto 20, 00191 Rome, Italy
